Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on freedom of speech, which is a fundamental human right.
The bill could lead to censorship of opinions that do not align with government or corporate interests.
Historical examples, such as Thalidomide and COVID-19 policies, demonstrate the dangers of suppressing dissenting opinions.
The exemption of government communications from being labeled as misinformation or disinformation is seen as Orwellian.
The legislation could suppress important debates on foreign policy and other critical issues.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is our unalienable right and why it is enshrined in Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
We do not live in a totalitarian state – and I for one do not want to – but with this legislation we are rapidly heading towards that.
The greatest enemy of good science is a closed mind.
